title: Milagros Guadalupe Rivera
text:
Hello! My name is Milagros Guadalupe Rivera, and I am a PhD student at the University of California, Santa Cruz.
I specialize in marine mammal conservation using emerging genomic tools. More broadly, I am passionate about population genetics and its applications for the conservation and management of long-lived mammals.
I love diving into genomic mysteries, working on data visualization, and finding new ways to use bioinformatics for conservation. When Iâ€™m not at my computer, you can find me exploring tide pools, hiking coastal trails, or enjoying a good cup of coffee! â˜•ðŸŒ¿

title: Research
text:
Genome Assembly of the Northern Elephant Seal


Exploring the genetic blueprint of northern elephant seals to understand their evolutionary history and conservation needs.





Understanding Population Structure and Local Adaptation


Investigating how landscape and seascape factors influence genetic diversity in northern elephant seals.





Detecting Marine Mammal Populations with Environmental DNA


Utilizing eDNA to track marine mammal populations in a non-invasive way.





Determining Kinship and Pedigree in a Northern Elephant Seal Colony


Using genomic tools to reconstruct pedigrees and understand family structures in elephant seals.
